intro: Achillea gerberi, commonly known as Gerber's yarrow, is a perennial herb native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring finely divided, fern-like leaves. Its flowers are small and white to pale yellow, arranged in flat-topped clusters. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands and open woodlands.
